Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: part of feline or sphinx (only hind leg with red patch and tail remaining) to right; part of pendant triangle and elaborate rosettes as fillling ornament; possibly part of a second animal, possibly a lion, behind first creature.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 558, pl. 71)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 82, no. 12, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0632) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
